docs.abstract: For more than a century, major teacher strikes like the one in West Virginia have come as educators have been asked to shoulder society’s biggest challenges and ills.
docs.snippet: For more than a century, major teacher strikes like the one in West Virginia have come as educators have been asked to shoulder society’s biggest challenges and ills.
docs.lead_paragraph: Raucous cheers echoed off the high marble ceilings of the West Virginia Capitol on Tuesday as state leaders announced they had met striking teachers’ demands for a 5 percent pay raise.

headline.main: Fighting Poverty, Drugs and Even Violence, All on a Teacher’s Salary
headline.print_headline: Fighting Poverty, Drugs and Even Violence, All on a Teacher’s Salary

docs.abstract: Marielle Franco, a political rising star and human rights advocate, was critical of security policy and the recent military intervention in the city.
docs.snippet: Marielle Franco, a political rising star and human rights advocate, was critical of security policy and the recent military intervention in the city.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — On the eve of her killing on a downtown street on Wednesday night, a Rio de Janeiro councilwoman suggested that the death of a young man earlier in the week had been the latest act of police brutality.

headline.main: Killing of Rio de Janeiro Councilwoman Critical of Police Rattles Brazil
headline.print_headline: Murder Of Politician And Driver Jars Brazil

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

docs.abstract: This astutely acted revival of Kenneth Lonergan’s play presents conversation as an ongoing act of deception and betrayal.
docs.snippet: This astutely acted revival of Kenneth Lonergan’s play presents conversation as an ongoing act of deception and betrayal.

headline.main: Review: Chris Evans and Michael Cera Tell Lies to Live by in ‘Lobby Hero’
headline.print_headline: Opening the Door to Truth and Lies

docs.abstract: African-Americans know what it feels like to be ignored by those in power. Thanks to Trump, the rest of America is getting a taste of that now.
docs.snippet: African-Americans know what it feels like to be ignored by those in power. Thanks to Trump, the rest of America is getting a taste of that now.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — During President Trump’s fund-raising trip to Beverly Hills, Calif., this month — the first time he’d come to the official state of resistance since becoming president — a couple of friends of mine took to the streets, along with hundreds of others, to protest. But the visit was highly stage-managed, and Mr. Trump never faced the crowd; the most my friends could do, they said, was raise a middle finger to the sky as his aircraft flew overhead.

headline.main: We’re All in the Ghetto Now
headline.print_headline: We’re All in the Ghetto Now

docs.abstract: The shooting of Stephon Clark has reignited the kind of protests against police killings that spread across the United States in recent years.
docs.snippet: The shooting of Stephon Clark has reignited the kind of protests against police killings that spread across the United States in recent years.
docs.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — Two police officers, 10 minutes, 20 bullets. Another young black man dead, this time in his grandmother’s backyard in California’s capital.

headline.main: 20 Shots in Sacramento: Stephon Clark Killing Reignites a Furor
headline.print_headline: Police Kill Another Unarmed Black Man, and Another City Seethes

docs.abstract: Brian Dykstra’s play about a student’s activist artwork lacks the kind of focus that teenagers around the country are bringing to issues like gun control.
docs.snippet: Brian Dykstra’s play about a student’s activist artwork lacks the kind of focus that teenagers around the country are bringing to issues like gun control.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, thousands of students walked out of their schools in a forceful protest calling for gun control. And on the stage at 59E59 Theaters, one high school kid, Mick, tried to burn a dollar-store American flag.

headline.main: Review: In ‘Education,’ a Fictional Protest That Pales Next to Real Ones
headline.print_headline: An Act of Protest Onstage, Paling Next to the Real Ones

docs.abstract: Megachurches around the country were trying to racially integrate and finding some success. Then came the 2016 election.
docs.snippet: Megachurches around the country were trying to racially integrate and finding some success. Then came the 2016 election.
docs.lead_paragraph: FORT WORTH — Charmaine Pruitt wrote the names of 12 churches on a sheet of paper, tore the paper into 12 strips, and dropped them into a Ziploc bag. It was Sunday morning and time to pick which church to attend.

headline.main: A Quiet Exodus: Why Black Worshipers Are Leaving White Evangelical Churches
headline.print_headline: A Quiet Exodus in White Evangelical Churches

docs.abstract: Melania Trump has long said she wants to curb online bullying. Her efforts often clash with the president's habit of using Twitter to insult people.
docs.snippet: Melania Trump has long said she wants to curb online bullying. Her efforts often clash with the president's habit of using Twitter to insult people.
docs.lead_paragraph: With a particular focus on social media, Melania Trump, the first lady, has long said she wants to curb online bullying and harassment as part of a nascent effort to improve the lives of American children. There’s one problem: Mrs. Trump’s efforts often clash with the president’s longtime habit of using social media to insult people.

headline.main: Melania Trump Wants to End Online Bullying. Her Husband Doesn’t Help.
headline.print_headline: First Lady Is Fighting Online Bullies; Her Husband Is a Repeat Offender

docs.abstract: A lawyer for the family said the findings proved that Mr. Clark could not have been moving in a threatening fashion toward Sacramento officers when they opened fire.
docs.snippet: A lawyer for the family said the findings proved that Mr. Clark could not have been moving in a threatening fashion toward Sacramento officers when they opened fire.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stephon Clark, the unarmed black man who was fatally shot last week by Sacramento police officers, was struck eight times, mostly in his back, according to an independent autopsy released Friday, raising significant questions about the police account that he was a threat to officers when he was hit.

headline.main: Stephon Clark Was Shot 8 Times Primarily in His Back, Family-Ordered Autopsy Finds
headline.print_headline: 8 Bullets Struck Sacramento Man As He Faced Away

byline.original: By Frances Robles and Jose A. Del Real

docs.abstract: Mr. Sharpton has been called a race hustler, a hero, a buffoon, a freedom fighter. He would prefer to be remembered as the Martin Luther King of the North.
docs.snippet: Mr. Sharpton has been called a race hustler, a hero, a buffoon, a freedom fighter. He would prefer to be remembered as the Martin Luther King of the North.
docs.lead_paragraph: “When I was born,” the Rev. Al Sharpton said through a plume of smoke, “you had all these movements. You had the anti-Vietnam War movement, you had the Panthers, you had King’s nonviolent movement, you had N.A.A.C.P., you had black power — all this flurry of activity. Then Dr. King gets killed. And what happened? Who won the election in ’68? Richard Nixon.”
